page.title: 02The Changing Face of Cliffe
page.content: At the end of the second world war, Cliffe was a small community of about l,OOO people, built around St. Helen's Church. Thatcher's Lane at the far end of the village received its name from a small farm that used to be situated there. At Norwood Corner there was a cinema which the local people called 'The Globe' but this was closed and pulled down. The Co-op, which you can still see, used to have a bakery, but it has closed now. Further up Church Street there was the Methodist Church. It closed down in l973 . During the post war period there have been several different shops in the village including a group called the Cliffe Market. There was a train station on the outskirts of Cliffe which closed in l96l.
